intro: Helichrysum gradatum, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, yellowish-orange flowers that are often retained on the plant even after blooming, giving it a decorative appearance. The plant produces small, bracted inflorescences that are typically composed of numerous tiny flowers. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Helichrysum gradatum is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and ornamental value.
